questiontext.text: A 29 year old G2P1 at 28 weeks gestation, who had normal hemoglobin level 4 weeks ago at her first prenatal visit complains of 1 week of fatique and now has hemoglobin level of 7,0 g/dL She noted dark colored urine after taking an antibiotic for urinary tract infection. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis ?

A 23 year old G1P0 at 38 weeks gestation, delivered a 3,9 kg baby vaginally. Upon delivery of the placenta, there was notes to be an inverted uterus, which was successfully managed including replacement of the uterus. Which of the following placental implantation sites would most likely predispose to an inverted uterus ?
The following antihypertensive agents are used in pregnancy except:
Which is true of Hepatitis B in pregnancy?

answer.text: Breastfeeding is always contraindicated in women who are chronic carriers of HBV.
Non-immune mothers should not be vaccinated after the second trimester.
The risk of fetal infection is higher if maternal infection occurs in the third trimester.
Only infants with HBV positive mothers should be vaccinated.

questiontext.text: Which of the following is true in regards to Toxoplasmosis?

answer.text: Indoor cats are not reservoirs for Toxoplasmosis.
Only HIV positive women should be screened for Toxoplasma.
15% of reproductive age women have antibodies to Toxoplasmosis.
Spiramycin may reduce risk of fetal transmission.
ALL of the above are TRUE

questiontext.text: Your patient is a 40-year-old G3P2 obese woman at 37 weeks gestation. Her pregnancy has been complicated by insulin-requiring gestational diabetes. Her most recent Hgb A1c was 6.0. The patient reports that her fasting and postprandial sugars have all been within normal range. Her fetus has an estimated weight of 2950 grams by Leopolds today. All of the following are correct ways to manage this patient except

answer.text: The patient should undergo an elective cesarean section at 38 weeks to avoid shoulder dystocia
The patient should be induced by 40 weeks if spontaneous labor does not occur
After 6 weeks postpartum, the patient should undergo a 75-g glucose tolerance test
In the postpartum period, it is acceptable to use oral contraceptives
A glucose infusion will be given to the patient in labor

questiontext.text: A 25 year old patient tell her doctor that she wants to have a child in the next few year. She is concerned as she has seizure disorder and taken valproic acid. It has been 1 year since her last seizure and she has heard that seizures are dangerous for the fetus. 2. Which of the following antiseizure medication, when taken as monotherapy, is associated with the highest of major congenital malformation ?
Methods of prenatal testing for congenital abnormalities – which of the following are true?

answer.text: Nuchal translucency (the space between skin and soft tissue overlying the cervical spine), measured between 11 and 13+6 weeks, is a screening test for chromosomal abnormalities such as trisomy 18.
When the fetus has an open neural tube defect (NTD), maternal serum AFP levels are usually raised. As such, this can be used as a diagnostic test for NTD.
Amniocentesis is safer than CVS before 12 weeks.
Structural abnormalities are usually diagnosed at 12 weeks at the ‘anomaly scan’.
Chorionic villus sampling (CVS) usually allows an abnormal fetus to be identified at 16 weeks.

questiontext.text: A monochorionic twin pregnancy showed a discordant crown–lump length (CRL) at 12 weeks gestation, and a discordant amniotic fluid volume at 15 weeks with a deepest vertical pocket of 1.8 cm in the smaller twin and 6.3 cm in the larger twin. Both bladders are visible. Which of the following is/are likely diagnosis(es)?

answer.text: Twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome Quintero Stage II.
Complicated monochorionic twin pregnancy, suspected to develop either selective fetal growth restriction or twin–twin transfusion syndrome (TTTS).
Velamentous cord insertion in one twin.

questiontext.text: Congenital syndromes related to viral infections are most likely to occur if the mother contracts the illness during which of the following trimesters?

A 39-year-old G2P1001 presents at 18–5/7 weeks’ gestation for her scheduled fetal anatomic survey. During the examination, the fetal anatomy is noted to be normal, but the cervical length is measured at 15 mm. Despite counseling about the lack of consistent data showing a benefit in this setting, the patient requests that a cervical cerclage be placed. Which of the following, if present, would be considered an absolute contraindication to cervical cerclage placement?

answer.text: Prolapse of fetal membranes into the vagina

questiontext.text: Poorly controlled maternal thyroid disease is associated with which of the following pregnancy complications?
How do circulating TSH levels change during pregnancy?
A patient presents for her first prenatal visit at 10 weeks’ gestation. Her routine prenatal intake laboratory tests reveal that she is not immune to rubella. What should you recommend?
Chorioamnionitis (intra-amniotic infection) is typically caused by which of the following organisms?
Intakes of vitamin A during pregnancy have not been associated with birth defects when it is given in doses ?
Kelainan kromosom seperti trisomi 21 terjadi pada fase ?
Which of the following vitamins, when combined with the antihistamine doxylamine, has been found to be helpful in cases of nausea and vomiting?
Maternal deficiency of vitamin D has been associated with which of the following complications in the offspring?
Periode fetus dimulai ?
Pada usia kehamilan berapakan lambung janin sudah mulai terisi dan terdeteksi pada saat pemeriksaan USG?

In the surgery you see a woman in her first pregnancy who is suffering from hyperemesis. You do not think that she needs admitting to hospital and prescribe an anti-emetic. Her teeth are in poor condition.Select the main reason for suggesting that she makes an appointment with a dentist:

answer.text: Hyperemesis can result in damage to maternal teeth
Periodontitis is a risk factor for low birth weight
Pregnant women are entitled to free dental care
The immune response to plaque bacteria is altered in pregnancy
There is an association between pregnancy and gingival hyperplasia

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements concerning HIV in pregnancy is true?

answer.text: In HIV-positive mothers on antiretroviral treatment breast-feeding is safe
Infants born to women who are HIV positive should be treated with antiretroviral therapy from birth
Interventions can reduce the risk of vertical HIV transmission from 30 per cent to zero
Use of short-term steroids to promote fetal lung maturation is inadvisable
Women who do not require treatment for their own health do not need to take antiretroviral therapy during pregnancy

questiontext.text: The most important reason that administration of ergometrine to control postpartum haemorrhage is contraindicated in a woman with pre- eclampsia is:

answer.text: It is likely to make her vomit profusely
It does not work as well as oxytocin
It gives a sustained effect rather than a quick onset of action
it is likely to increase her blood pressure

questiontext.text: According to WHO, anemia in pregnancy is diagnosed, when hemoglobin is less than :
Which of the following features indicates the presence of heart disease in pregnancy and which is not seen in normal pregnancy ?
Commonenst congenital malformation in infant of a diabetic mother is :

A G2P1A0 diabetic mother present at 32 weeks pregnancy, there is history of full term fetal demise in last pregnancy. Her vitals sign are stable, blood glucose and fetus is stable. Which the following will be the most appropriate management ?
Ascending infection of the vagina can induce premature labour. Which pathogen ismost commonly associated with bacterial vaginosis ?
What is the minimal daily dose of elemental iron taken throughout the latter half of pregnancy to sufficiently meet the requirement of the mother and her fetus ?

A woman with preexisting type 2 diabetes that was previously treated with metformin and glibenclamide switched to insulin during pregnancy to improve her blood glucose control. The insulin was stopped after delivery and she is breast-feeding her baby.Select the most appropriate management advice during the time she is breast-feeding:

answer.text: Avoid any oral blood glucose lowering medication whilst breast-feeding
BBoth metformin and glibenclamide can be taken whilst breast-feeding
Metformin should be avoided until she ceases breast-feeding
She should have a snack before breast-feeding
There is an increased risk of hypoglycaemia during breast-feeding

questiontext.text: You see a 31-year-old primigravida at 26 weeks’ gestation who presents with worsening fatigue, sweating, insomnia, loss of weight and palpitations. She reports good fetal movements. Physical examination shows exophthalmos, an enlarged nontender thyroid gland and ne hand tremors. Her thyroid function test results show a SH less than 0.05 mU/L (normal range 0.4–5.0) and a 4 of 70 pmol/L (normal range 10–20). You counsel her regarding the risks of poorly controlled hyperthyroidism in pregnancy. Which of the following is not are cognized risk?
You are asked to update your unit guidelines on antenatal aspirin. Which of the following patients should have aspirin 75 mg daily from 12weeks’ gestation?

answer.text: 23-year-old primigravida with a BMI of 36 at booking.
32-year-old para 1 whose mother developed preeclampsia at 27 weeks gestation
34-year-old para 1 with a BMI of 34 at booking who developed gestational diabetes in her previous  pregnancy.
39-year-old para 1 (previous unexplained stillbirth at 36 weeks’ gestation
39-year-old para 1 (who delivered an SGA baby at 35 weeks, 12 years ago

questiontext.text: With reference to iron deficiency anaemia in pregnancy, except?

answer.text: Iron demand in pregnancy increases to 4 mg per day.
High levels of serum ferritin confirm the diagnosis.
It is more common in multiple pregnancy.
It is usually treated with oral iron.

questiontext.text: A 32-year-old woman primigravida who is 34 weeks pregnant attends the antenatal clinic complaining of severe itching.Serum bile acids are found to be elevated and she is diagnosed with obstetric cholestasis.What is the most effective medication to improve her itching?
A 25 year old nulliparous patient with HIV wishes to become pregnant. Which of the following is true?

answer.text: Even with appropriate antiretroviral therapy, neonatal infection occurs 20-25% of the time.
Fetal scalp electrode monitoring should be avoided.
With appropriate antiretroviral therapy, breastfeeding is safe in these patients.
If the mother is untreated and has a high viral load, pursue a vaginal delivery

questiontext.text: A women with severe ankle sprain was prescribed ibuprofen for 72 hours. At what gestational age should she avoid this medication?

Prenatal care is a structured approach to obstetric care to asses for increase risk of complications or the actual development of problems. Which of the following most predispose the patient to obstetrical complication?

answer.text: History of ovarian dermoid cyst removed 4 years ago
a clinical measured pelvic diagonal conjugate of 12 cm

questiontext.text: Methods of prenatal testing for congenital abnormalities – which of the following are true?

answer.text: Nuchal translucency (the space between skin and soft tissue overlying the cervical spine), measured between 11 and 13+6 weeks, is a screening test for chromosomal abnormalities such as trisomy 18.
When the fetus has an open neural tube defect (NTD), maternal serum AFP levels are usually raised. As such, this can be used as a diagnostic test for NTD.
Amniocentesis is safer than CVS before 12 weeks.
Structural abnormalities are usually diagnosed at 12 weeks at the ‘anomaly scan’.
Chorionic villus sampling (CVS) usually allows an abnormal fetus to be identified at 16 weeks.

questiontext.text: Structural abnormalities identifiable as part of antenatal care – which of the following is true?

answer.text: Preconceptual folic acid supplementation for 3 months (1 mg/day) reduces the incidence of hydrocephaly and should be taken by all women considering pregnancy.
Diaphragmatic hernias rarely result in the fetus having pulmonary hypoplasia.

questiontext.text: Most obstetrical providers screen pregnant women for gestational diabetes around 28 weeks gestation. The increased risk of developing diabetes in pregnancy is due to which of the following ?

answer.text: decreased free fatty acids in maternal circulation

questiontext.text: Pada usia kehamilan berapakan lambung janin sudah mulai terisi dan terdeteksi pada saat pemeriksaan USG?
What of the following is part of rouitine mid trimesters scan ?
The most important reason that administration of ergometrine to control postpartum haemorrhage is contraindicated in a woman with pre- eclampsia is:

answer.text: It is likely to make her vomit profusely
It does not work as well as oxytocin
It gives a sustained effect rather than a quick onset of action
It is likely to increase her blood pressure

questiontext.text: According to WHO, anemia in pregnancy is diagnosed, when hemoglobin is less than :
Pasangan Tuan X dan Y ingin punya anak. Nyonya Y diketahui penderita HIV, persiapan yang diperlukan oleh Nyonya Y

answer.text: Tidak perlu periksa kadar CD4 dan viral load, untuk mengetahui apakah sudah layak untuk hamil, yang penting sudah konsumsi ARV 6 bulan
Bila VL tidak terdeteksi atau kadar CD4 kurang dari 350 sel/mm3, sanggama tanpa kontrasepsi dapat dilakukan, terutama pada masa subur.
Bila kadar CD4 masih kurang dari 350 sel/mm3, minum ARV secara teratur dan disiplin minimal selama enam bulan dan tetap menggunakan kondom selama sanggama.
D. Kadar VL > 1000 diperbolehkan hamil, yang penting terus konsumsi ARV

questiontext.text: Your 25-year-old patient is pregnant at 36 weeks gestation. She has an acute urinary tract infection (UTI). Of the following medications used in the treatment of UTIs, which is contraindicated in the treatment of this patient?

A 28-year-old G2 para 1 at 28 weeks’ gestation attends the antenatal clinicto discuss vaginal birth a er caesarean section (VBAC). She had a previous emergency caesarean section 3 years ago for undiagnosed breech in labour. Which one of the following is true concerning VBAC?

answer.text: It is contraindicated in women with previous classical caesarean section.
chances of successful vaginal birth is around 50%.

questiontext.text: A woman with preexisting type 2 diabetes that was previously treated with metformin and glibenclamide switched to insulin during pregnancy to improve her blood glucose control. The insulin was stopped after delivery and she is breast-feeding her baby.Select the most appropriate management advice during the time she is breast-feeding:

answer.text: Avoid any oral blood glucose lowering medication whilst breast-feeding
Both metformin and glibenclamide can be taken whilst breast-feeding
Metformin should be avoided until she ceases breast-feeding
She should have a snack before breast-feeding
There is an increased risk of hypoglycaemia during breast-feeding

questiontext.text: A 30-year-old woman is diagnosed with gestational diabetes fol- lowing an oral glucose tolerance test (OGGT) at 26 weeks gesta- tion in her first pregnancy. Her fasting blood glucose is 7.2 mmol/l. What is the appropriate management?

A 28-year-old white woman comes to your clinic for prenatal care reporting a new-onset severe headache. She is currently pregnant with twins at an estimated gestational age of 22 weeks. Her obstetric history is significant for one previous term singleton vaginal delivery at 24 years of age without complications; she has had no other pregnan- cies. You use a manual sphygmomanometer on her left arm while she is seated and find that her blood pressure is 154/86 mm Hg. She has no history of elevated blood pressure, and her body mass index is 24 kg per m2. Based on the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) recommendation statement, which one of the following statements about the diagnosis of pre- eclampsia in this patient is accurate?

answer.text: You should use a validated risk prediction tool, such as the uterine artery pulsatility index, to diagnose preeclampsia.
You can diagnose preeclampsia only after re- peated elevated blood pressure measurements combined with certain associated signs, symp- toms, or laboratory results.
You can diagnose preeclampsia only after the detection of elevated urine protein.
You cannot diagnose preeclampsia yet because the patient’s gestational age is less than 24 weeks.
You should confirm the diagnosis of preeclamp- sia immediately by taking another blood pressure measurement in the upper arm with the patient in the left lateral position.

questiontext.text: A 28-year-old white woman comes to your clinic for prenatal care reporting a new-onset severe headache. She is currently pregnant with twins at an estimated gestational age of 22 weeks. Her obstetric history is significant for one previous term singleton vaginal delivery at 24 years of age without complications; she has had no other pregnan- cies. You use a manual sphygmomanometer on her left arm while she is seated and find that her blood pressure is 154/86 mm Hg. She has no history of elevated blood pressure, and her body mass index is 24 kg per m2. Which one of the following characteristics increases this patient’s risk of developing preeclampsia?

answer.text: She has a body mass index of 24 kg per m2.

questiontext.text: A 28-year-old white woman comes to your clinic for prenatal care reporting a new-onset severe headache. She is currently pregnant with twins at an estimated gestational age of 22 weeks. Her obstetric history is significant for one previous term singleton vaginal delivery at 24 years of age without complications; she has had no other pregnan- cies. You use a manual sphygmomanometer on her left arm while she is seated and find that her blood pressure is 154/86 mm Hg. She has no history of elevated blood pressure, and her body mass index is 24 kg per m2. You take another blood pressure measurement during the same visit using appropriate technique and find that it has decreased to 118/74 mm Hg. She has no protein in her urine. Which of the following are the most appropriate next steps for this patient?

answer.text: Recommend that she take daily low-dose aspirin to decrease the risk of preeclampsia, preterm birth, and intrauterine growth restriction.
At subsequent prenatal visits, screen for pre- eclampsia with urine protein testing, not blood pressure measurement.
No need to monitor her blood pressure at every prenatal visit.
Prescribe an antihypertensive medication to decrease her blood pressure.

questiontext.text: Seorang ibu hamil G2P1 gravid 26 minggu datang ke poliklinik untuk ANC. Pada pemeriksaan laboratoirum yang dilakukan didapatkan kadar hemoglobin 11,2 gr%, MCV 68 fL dan MCH 23 pg dan MCHC 26 g/DL, Rhesus (+) . Pada pemeriksaan USG di dapatkan taksiran berat badan janin, 1070 gram, plasenta dan air ketuban normal. Pada kasus ibu ini maka tindakan yang harus dilakukan adalah :

answer.text: Anjurkan untuk mendapat suntikan imunoglobulin Anti Rhesus D
Anjurkan pemeriksaan karyotyping untuk memastikan rhesus janin
Anjurkan pemeriksaan analisis hemoglobin dan kadar ferritin serum
Anjurkan suami pasien untuk melakukan pemeriksaan Rhesus

questiontext.text: Pernyataan dibawah ini yang benar terkait dengan rhesus adalah

answer.text: Imunoprofilaksis sebaiknya diberikan pada usia kehamilan 12 minggu
Reaksi sensitisasi akan terjadi bila ibu dengan goilongan darah Rh (+) menikah dengan suami yang memiliki golongan darah Rh(-)
Antibodi rhesus baru akan terbentuk pada usia kehamilan 28 minggu
Pemberian imunorprofilaksis tetap harus diberikan pada ibu pasca persalinan walaupun telah menjalani tubektomi
Antigen utama untuk menentukan rhesus positif adalah antigen Duffy

questiontext.text: Pernyataan dibawah ini yang benar terkait dengan thalasemia adalah

answer.text: Sub unit alfa hemoglobin disandi di kromosom no 11
Sub unit beta hemoglobin disandi di kromoson no.16
Thalasemia alfa yang mengalami delesi 3 gen disebut kelainan hemoglobin Barts
Pada pemeriksaan usg terhadap kehamilan dengan janin thalassemia maka dapat ditemukan ukuran yolk sac lebih dari 6 mm
Ibu yang carier thalassemia bila menikah dengan suami yang normal maka kemungkinan 50% keturuanannya akan menderita thalasemia

questiontext.text: A 21-year-old G`P0 woman is seen for her first prenatal visit at the obstetrician's office. Based on the LMP, the patient is 36 weeks gestation. On ultrasound, the measurements indicate 32 weeks for all parameters including the HC, AC, and FL. Which of the following is the best management for this patient?

A 27 year-old G2P1 woman is at 37 weeks gestation supported by LMP and a 10 week ulotrasound. The estimated fetal weight is 2000 g, which is less than the 3rd percentile for gestational age. The doppler studies indicate the presence of forward end-diastolic flow. You recommend delivery fot this patient. Which of the following is the best reason for your recommendation?

answer.text: A fetal weight of 2000 g correlates with a high survival in the nursery
IUGR carries a signiificant risk of fetal death
The doppler studies indicate a concern for contonuing the pregnancy
with delivery, further diagnostic studies such as karyotype and viral studies canbe conducted

questiontext.text: an 18-year-old G1P0 woman at 38 weeks" gestation confirmed by a 12 week ultrasound has a fundal height of 34 cm. The patient has gained 20 lbs during the pregnancy,. She denies smoking or alcohol or illicit substance use. Her BP is 110/70. Which of the following is the best management of this patient?

answer.text: Schedule for delivery since the patient has reached a term gestational age
Schedule biophysical profile and dopp[er studies for this patient
send her urine for a drug screen and consider serum TORCH titers

questiontext.text: A 25-year-old woman at 34 weeks' gestation is noted to have a placentaprevia after she presented with vaginal bleeding and has undergone sonography. At 37 weeks, she has a scheduled secarean. Upon cesarean sectiom, bluish tissue densely adherent between the uterus and maternal bladder is noted. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 29-year-old 1Po woman at 39 weeks' gestation deliverd vaginally. Her placenta does not deliver easily. A manual extraction of the placenta is attemped and the palcenta seems to be adherent to the uterus. A hysterectomy is contemplated, but the patient refuses due to strongly desiring more children. The cord is ligated with suture as high as possible. The patient is given the option of methotrexate therapy. Which of the following is the most complication after this intervention?

A 28-year-old G1P0 woman is diagnosed as having a twin gestation at 15 weeks gestation. Careful examination of the membranes reveals that there is avery thinmembrane between two fetuses. Whic of the following statementsis most accurate?

answer.text: it is likely that one fetuses ia a male and the other a female
it is likely that this is a dyzigotic gestation
it is likely that this is a monozygotic gestation
it is likely that there are two separate placenta

questiontext.text: A 25-year-old G2P1A0 woman at 27 weeks gestation has been followed for twin gestation. She is undergone her third ultrasound examination today. Her ultrasound findings are as follows : Twin A : estimated fetal weight is 500 g and amniotic fluid 2 cm; Twin B : EFW 1100 g and SDP 26 cm. Which of the following the best next step for this patient?

A 23-year-old G1P0 woman at 20 weeks gestation undergoes an ultrasound examination for asize greater than her dates. The ultrasoundrevelas hydramnions with bdominal region, and an amniotic fluid index of 30 cm. The fetal abdomen reveals a cystic mass in the right abdomen region, and a cystic mass in the left abdominal area. Which of the following is the most likely associated condition?

A 22-year-old woman is seeen for her first prenatal visit at 16 weeks gestation with a family history of congenital deafness and neonatal renall disease. The patient"s hearing is normal. Which of the following is the best next step?

A 29-year-old G1P0 at 19 weeks gestation is noted to have dysuria, urinary frequency, and urgency. A urine culture is performed, and growth is noted, which the microbiology laboratory notes as not E.coli. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism of cystits?

A 36-year-old G2P1 woman at 24 weeks gestation is noed to have fatique of 4 weeks' duration. her hemoglobin level is 8.0g/d, leukocyte count is 2.0cells/uL. and platelet count is 20.000/uL. Which is the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old G1P0 woman complains of nausea and vomiting fpr the first 3 months of her pregnancy. She is noted to have level of 9.0 g/dL. and a meancorpuscular volume of 110 fL. Which of the following is the most likely etiology of the anemia?

A 33-year-old G1P0 woman at 39 weeks gestation is in labor. She has been diagnosed with a herpes gestations with the characgeristic prurotus and vesicular lesions on the abdomen. WHich of the following precautions i the best advised for the patient?

answer.text: neonatal lesions may be noted and will resolve
vaginal delivery is permissible if the lessions ate not in the introitus region and provided that oral acyclovir is given to the baby
tocolysis and oral steroid use is advisable until the lesions are heated

questiontext.text: a 26-year-old woman is noted to be at 29 weeks gestation. Her last pregnancy ended in delivery at 30 weeks gestation. In screening for various types of infection, which of the following is the most likely to be associated with preterm delivery?

A 30-year-old woman G2P0A1 at 32 weeks' estation and is diagnosed with PPROM. She is placed on bed rest and reports cointinued leakeage of clear fluid each day. There are no signs of onfedtion. A fetal heart rate tracing is performed twice weekly. Today, there is an abnormality of the fetal heart rate tracing. Which of the following is most likely to be seeen?

A 30-year-old woman G2P0A1 at 32 weeks' estation and is diagnosed with PPROM. She is placed on bed rest and reports cointinued leakeage of clear fluid each day. There are no signs of onfedtion. A fetal heart rate tracing is performed twice weekly. Today, there is an abnormality of the fetal heart rate tracing. Which of the following is most likely to be seeen? - Copy

A 29 year old G2P1 at 28 weeks gestation, who had normal hemoglobin level 4 weeks ago at her first prenatal visit complains of 1 week of fatique and now has hemoglobin level of 7,0 g/dL She noted dark colored urine after taking an antibiotic for urinary tract infection. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis ? - Copy
